name: digdugz
text: I would like to get my hands on said dare book.

name: stevegt500
text: I as well

name: spinynorman
text: Gonna have to reference PG Wodehouse in lieu of Achewood yet again.

name: farqussus
text: When? Hop to it!

name: spinynorman
text: Well... I kinda thought that last comment... was it? Am I lazy?

name: tekende
text: That is not the adjective I would use to describe you, no

name: straw
text: Spot on, Jeeves.

name: spaghettis-dad
text: Right-ho

name: dusty
text: It would be worth writing, though finding anyone alive who was college age in the 20's would be awfully hard, then once you got down to the ones who were tricksters in college and who still remembered any of it you would probably be down to none. I suppose the only way would be to read countless college related articles and stories from the 20's and compile a list of college dares from there. Perhaps I am over thinking this and should just do what most historians do and make it all up, then if anyone cares enough to complain, use the data in their complaint to add to the book, thank them and act like it was a mistake.

name: 1000hz
text: The altitude to which Ray's jaw drops in Panel 6 coupled with his blank stare is priceless.

name: ford
text: How can you tell when Ray is wearing a blank stare as opposed to, say, an interested gaze?

name: 1000hz
text: Eyebrows, man. Eyebrows.

name: epicurus
text:
big ups for both the way Ray twirls his foot while thinking of a lie and also for his covering his obvious swear as him eating a hot pepper while on the phone with his mother as a dare from the 1920's.

I also love how ready his mother is to believe that he was eating a hot pepper and not saying "bastard" which he obviously was.

name: epicurus
text: er... "son of a bitch".

name: sargasm
text:
Dare #42. To be performed whilst one is employed about a telephone-conversation with one's mother.

1. Consume one (1) chili pepper.

name: caduceo
text: did they stop spelling pepper as "peper" in the 20's? IN george washington's time, they spelled it peper. it mult sizzle!

name: mattfish
text: you mean muft. it muft sizzle.

name: overmedicated
text: Hehe... muft.

name: jackparsons
text:
"I dare you to vote for Calvin Coolidge!"
"I double-dare you to join the Wobblies!"
"I triple-dare you to kiss a woman!"

name: tekende
text: "I triple-dog dare you to stone cold shoot a man."

name: opalleye
text: Is it right to dare one to do something illegal?

name: boredom_man
text: Voting for Coolidge? That might be the way they conduct elections in Chicago, young man, but here in Boston we have a little principle called democracy .

name: tekende
text: What's the point otherwise?

name: mrtatulas
text: Kiss a woman? I should box your ears! Do you suggest that I am a boorish Yale man?

name: epicurus
text: Notice that in panel 4 the text box goes BEHIND Ray instead of over him like in the last panel and most other strips. Zooming on Ray's face and fading out his mother's voice as dread sets in.

name: dasuta
text: Who taught you to eat chili peppers on the phone?

name: hereward
text: Dare #20: Go to the disreputable area of the city and get a haircut there.

name: doomchild
text:
Dare #16: Stop a passerby and query, "Pardon me, but do you have any Grey Poupon," while holding nothing to which said emollient would be applied.

DC

name: tekende
text: Dare #73: Call on a young lady, and when you enter the sitting room, do not remove your hat.

name: direhaggis
text: Todd is hell of dumb squirrel. You don't hit up a dude for 6 million, then invite over his obviously proper mother to tour a company set on marketing fake nutsacks for cell phones. This is an unwise career enrichment strategy.

name: red-barchetta
text: I...I've had such conversations with my mother. The chili pepper distraction did not work so well for me.

name: a386
text: ray is lying so hard he has to spin his leg around in the air. i have actually had that happen to me while playing jazz music so i understand how it can be a reaction to extreme improvisational thought processes. fucking genius
